fields.title: Postgres
fields.markdown_text:
#### Change a User's Password

    ALTER USER davide WITH PASSWORD 'hu8jmn3';
fields.html_text:
Change a User's Password

ALTER USER davide WITH PASSWORD 'hu8jmn3';

fields.title: Jenkins CI
fields.markdown_text:
#### To give Jenkins a new port edit the file at:

    /etc/default/jenkins

and add the port number you want to the `HTTP_PORT VARIABLE`:

    # port for HTTP connector (default 8080; disable with -1)
    HTTP_PORT=9090


Then you should restart Jenkins with `sudo service jenkins restart`.
fields.html_text:
To give Jenkins a new port edit the file at:

/etc/default/jenkins

and add the port number you want to the HTTP_PORT VARIABLE:

# port for HTTP connector (default 8080; disable with -1)
HTTP_PORT=9090

Then you should restart Jenkins with sudo service jenkins restart.

fields.title: Git
fields.markdown_text:
#### Changing the default Git remote 'push to' default

To change which upstream remote is "wired" to your branch, use the git branch command with the upstream configuration flag. Ensure the remote exists first:

    git remote -v

Set the preferred remote for the current (checked out) branch:

    git branch --set-upstream-to <remote-name>

Validate the branch is setup with the correct upstream remote:

    git branch -vv
fields.html_text:
Changing the default Git remote 'push to' default

To change which upstream remote is "wired" to your branch, use the git branch command with the upstream configuration flag. Ensure the remote exists first:

git remote -v

Set the preferred remote for the current (checked out) branch:

git branch --set-upstream-to <remote-name>

Validate the branch is setup with the correct upstream remote:

git branch -vv
